engineering_design_principles.mechanism: Leftover data from previous processes provide valuable insights into the system and its behavior, making data collection and analysis crucial for understanding and improving the system.
Redundant components, such as multiple satellites, can provide backup and continuity in case of failure, increasing the reliability and robustness of the system.
Studying the interactions between different components, such as satellites and their orbits, can help us understand and improve the overall system.
Monitoring and analyzing the behavior of the system, such as the orbits of satellites, can provide valuable feedback for improving the system and avoiding collisions.
Designing systems that can adapt to changing conditions, such as the influence of external factors on satellite orbits, can increase the resilience and longevity of the system.
